item.title: 穆勒称欧洲央行必须耐心等待进一步降息
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员马迪斯-穆勒（Madis Muller）认为，欧洲中央银行可能会在年底前再次降低借贷成本，但不应急于这么做。【原文：The European Central Bank can probably lower borrowing costs again before year-end, but shouldn’t rush to do so, according to Governing Council member Madis Muller.】

item.title: 金多斯称欧洲央行未遵循预定利率路径
item.description: 欧洲央行副行长路易斯-德金多斯（Luis de Guindos）在接受 CNBC 采访时表示，由于不确定性仍然很高，欧洲央行并没有按照预先设定的路径降低利率。【原文：The European Central Bank isn’t following a pre-set path toward lower interest rates as uncertainty remains high, Vice President Luis de Guindos told CNBC in an interview.】

item.title: 100 万人次香港居民前往中国度假避暑
item.description: 在截至 7 月 1 日的三天假期中，香港居民前往中国其他地区的旅行次数超过 110 万，这给生意惨淡的本地零售商和餐馆带来了更大的压力。【原文：Hong Kong residents made more than 1.1 million trips to the rest of China during a three-day holiday ending July 1, piling more pressure on local retailers and restaurants who are struggling for business.】

item.title: 上一财年外国基金持有的日本股票创历史新高
item.description: 去年，外国投资者持有的日本股票攀升至创纪录水平，约占三分之一，对市场的影响力最大。【原文：Foreign investors’ ownership of Japanese stocks climbed to a record last year, holding about a third, giving them the most sway over the market.】

item.title: 壳牌暂停荷兰生物燃料工厂建设以降低成本
item.description: 壳牌石油公司（Shell Plc）暂时中止了在荷兰的生物燃料工厂的建设，以寻求降低项目成本的方法。【原文：Shell Plc has temporarily paused construction of a biofuels plant in the Netherlands in order to seek ways to cut the cost of the project.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长莱恩称需要6月以后的数据来明确服务业发展路径
item.description: 欧洲中央银行首席经济学家菲利普-莱恩（Philip Lane）认为，上个月的通胀数据无法回答欧洲中央银行对潜在物价压力挥之不去的疑问。【原文：Inflation data for last month won’t provide answers to the European Central Bank’s lingering questions on underlying price pressures, according to Chief Economist Philip Lane.】

item.title: 卡扎克称市场对欧洲央行 1-2 次降息的预期与基线一致
item.description: 理事会成员马丁斯-卡扎克斯在接受 CNBC 采访时表示，欧洲央行今年将再降息一到两次的预期似乎 "相当合理"。【原文：Expectations that the European Central Bank will cut interest rates one or two more times this year seem “quite reasonable,” Governing Council member Martins Kazaks told CNBC in an interview.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：股市有望重拾跌势
item.description: 2024年4月23日星期二，英国伦敦市，伦敦证券交易所集团公司办公中庭的一块板上显示股票价格信息。4 月 21 日（周一），富时 100 指数收盘价创下一年多来的新高，原因是近期股市波动和地缘政治风险促使投资者纷纷涌入英国基准指数中的防御性板块。摄影：Hollie Adams/Bloomberg【原文：Stock price information displayed on a board at the London Stock Exchange Group Plc in the company's office atrium in the City of London, UK, on Tuesday, April 23, 2024. The FTSE 100 Index closed at a record high, on Monday, April 21, for the first time in more than a year, as recent equity market volatility and geopolitical risks prompted investors to pile into the defensive sectors that characterize the UK benchmark. Photographer: Hollie Adams/Bloomberg】

item.title: 监管机构禁止分级交易费，印度券商股价下跌
item.description: 印度证券交易所被勒令对交易收取统一费用，减少了一些公司的收入，导致印度券商股价暴跌。【原文：Shares of Indian brokerages tumbled after stock exchanges were ordered to charge a flat fee for transactions, reducing some firms’ income.】

item.title: 花旗银行：马来西亚支出显示削减燃料补贴迫在眉睫
item.description: 据花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：Malaysia’s fiscal spending for the first five months of the year underscored an urgent need to reform fuel subsidies so that the country can meet its 2024 deficit target, according to Citigroup Inc.】

item.title: 中国新房销售在一边倒的复苏中挣扎
item.description: 尽管特大城市的二手房交易量有所回升，但中国开发商仍面临着新房库存卸货的困难。【原文：Chinese developers are facing headwinds offloading new home inventory, despite a rebound in second-hand transactions in mega cities.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事欧洲
item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况

Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

】

item.title: 印尼正在准备保护当地纺织业的方法
item.description: 印度尼西亚正准备通过可能包括保障关税在内的措施来保护本国纺织业。【原文：Indonesia is preparing ways to protect its local textile industry through measures that may include safeguard duties.】

item.title: 敦促澳大利亚养老金为即将到来的退休潮做好准备
item.description: 行业监督机构表示，澳大利亚 3.9 万亿澳元（2.6 万亿美元）的养老金行业应加大力度跟踪和改善会员的养老金结果，为即将到来的退休潮做好准备。【原文：Australia’s A$3.9 trillion ($2.6 trillion) pension sector should do more to prepare for the coming wave of retirees by enhancing efforts to track and improve results for members, industry watchdogs said.】

item.title: 中国股票套期保值创 12 年新低 建议交易员保持冷静
item.description: 说到在香港交易的中国股票的套期保值，期权交易商们似乎有了度假的心情。【原文：When it comes to hedging of Chinese stocks traded in Hong Kong, options traders appear to be in holiday mood.】

item.title: 摩根大通称是时候对看跌国债押注获利了结了
item.description: 在建议投资者抛售五年期国债三周后，摩根大通银行（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：Three weeks after recommending investors sell five-year Treasuries, strategists at JPMorgan Chase & Co. say it’s time to pocket profits from the trade.】

item.title: 法国勒庞的障碍正在打破。债券市场不会
item.description:
欧元区的规则和对利兹-特鲁斯式崩溃的恐惧可能会使极右翼政府无法脱轨。【原文：

Eurozone rules and fears of a Liz Truss-style meltdown could keep a far-right government from going off the rails.

】

item.title: 曼哈顿房屋销售意外上升，买家因降息而退缩
item.description: 曼哈顿的房屋销售两年来首次出现增长，原因是等待利率下降的急不可耐的购房者纷纷出手。【原文：Manhattan home sales rose for the first time in two years as impatient buyers who had been waiting for interest rates to fall took the plunge.】

item.title: 英国成为受法国动荡影响投资者的避风港
item.description: 在英国准备于周四进行投票之际，该国的金融市场似乎正在摆脱近期的动荡声誉。【原文：As the UK prepares to head to the polls on Thursday, the country’s financial markets appear to be shedding their recent reputation for volatility.】

item.title: 瑞典房价连续第六个月上涨
item.description: 由于借贷利率下降提振了北欧国家的经济前景，瑞典住房价格在 6 月份连续第六个月上涨。【原文：Swedish housing prices gained for a sixth straight month in June as declining borrowing rates boost the Nordic nation’s economic prospects.】

item.title: 韩国加密货币交易所努力消除退市担忧
item.description: 韩国主要的加密货币交易所试图回击这样一种观点，即保护投资者的新规则可能会迅速扼杀韩国一些标志性的小型数字资产投机交易。【原文：South Korea’s leading crypto exchanges sought to push back on the idea that new rules to protect investors may quickly choke some of the nation’s hallmark speculative trading in smaller digital assets.】

item.title: 中国更多省份将试管婴儿纳入医保，努力提高出生率
item.description: 中国东部经济中心江苏省将医疗保险范围扩大到一系列辅助生殖服务，这是响应中国政府号召扭转内地出生率下降趋势的最新地区。【原文：China’s eastern economic hub Jiangsu extended medical insurance coverage to a slew of assisted reproductive services, the latest region heeding Beijing’s call to reverse the mainland’s declining birth rate.】

item.title: Segantii 香港内幕交易案延期至 10 月 15 日审理
item.description: 针对对冲基金公司 Segantii Capital Management、其创始人西蒙-萨德勒（Simon Sadler）和前交易员丹尼尔-拉罗卡（Daniel La Rocca）的内幕交易案已延期至 10 月 15 日。【原文：The insider dealing case against hedge fund firm Segantii Capital Management, its founder Simon Sadler and former trader Daniel La Rocca has been adjourned to Oct. 15.】

item.title: 穆克什-安巴尼的信实集团市值将增加 1000 亿美元
兴登堡就阿达尼报告抨击印度监管机构
item.description: 兴登堡研究公司（Hindenburg Research）在 6 月份收到印度证券交易委员会（Securities and Exchange Board）的通知后，指责该委员会未能处理其在去年年初关于阿达尼集团的卖空报告中指控的欺诈行为。【原文：Hindenburg Research called out the Securities and Exchange Board of India for failing to address the fraud it alleged in a short-selling report on the Adani Group early last year, after receiving a notice from the regulator in June.】

item.title: 欧罗巴航空公司飞往乌拉圭途中发生气流颠簸导致数十人受伤
item.description: 欧洲航空公司的一架航班在从马德里飞往乌拉圭蒙得维的亚的途中遭遇严重气流颠簸，造成约四十名乘客受伤。【原文：Some forty passengers were injured when an Air Europa flight hit severe turbulence on its way from Madrid to Montevideo, Uruguay, the latest in a series of bumpy incidents that have rattled travelers.】

item.title: 日本推动激进投资者运动创历史新高
item.description: 拉扎德公司（Lazard Inc.【原文：New campaigns by shareholder activists reached record levels globally in the first six months of the year, data from Lazard Inc. show.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行认为近期数据不足以促使现金利率上调
item.description: 澳大利亚央行认为，6 月份将利率维持在 12 年高位的理由是 "更充分的理由"，因为近期数据不足以改变其长期坚持的评估，即通胀率将在 2026 年恢复到目标水平。【原文：Australia’s central bank saw the case to hold interest rates at a 12-year high in June as the “stronger one” as recent data hadn’t been sufficient to change its long-held assessment that inflation would return to target by 2026.】

item.title: 世界上最不稳定的大股票正在震撼印尼市场
item.description: 它的股价走势图就像一只新兴市场的仙股：在不到九个月的时间里，股价暴涨 1200%，两次暴跌超过 40%。【原文：Its share-price chart resembles that of an emerging-market penny stock: a 1,200% surge punctuated by two crashes of more than 40% — all in the span of less than nine months.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。全球最大经济体制造业出现隐忧。华尔街思考唐纳德-特朗普的总统任期。中国最畅销汽车品牌销量大增。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. Manufacturing worries emerge in the world’s biggest economies. Wall Street ponders a Donald Trump presidency. China’s best-selling car brand boosts sales. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Kristine Aquino】
